text:
2.3 Mini-Quest 1: The Half-Memory
Evaluate ((I^{1/2} 1)(t)).
Answer:
\[
(I^{1/2} 1)(t) = \frac{2}{\sqrt{\pi}}\, t^{1/2}.
\]
Acharya Anvaya: Well done, Ananya. You have grasped the essence of fractional memory. You now hold the Key of Smriti (Memory). With it, the temple doors open to the next journey. {.teacher} The fractional integral is like oral tradition: newer retellings weigh more, but the first telling is never fully erased. {.narrator} A smaller () preserves distant past more strongly — like stories handed down for centuries. {.narrator}
A larger () emphasizes the near past — like yesterday’s lived experiences. {.narrator}
